summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence between defense attorney Joseph E. Nascimento and federal prosecutors (likely from the SDNY) regarding the scheduling of meetings and interviews with Nascimento's client, a cooperating witness in the Epstein investigation. The emails discuss logistics, travel, pandemic protocols, and the client's ongoing cooperation following Ghislaine Maxwell's arrest.

persons.name: Joseph E. Nascimento
persons.context: Attorney representing a cooperating witness in the Epstein investigation. He communicates with federal prosecutors to schedule meetings, proffers, and interviews for his client.

persons.name: Alan Ross
persons.context: Deceased former law partner of Joseph Nascimento who previously represented the cooperating witness (referred to as 'her') before his death in 2018.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned in the context of her arrest, which prompted Attorney Nascimento to check in with prosecutors about his client's status.

connections.description: Former law partners. Nascimento took over representation of Ross's client after Ross's death.
Nascimento's client is a cooperating witness in the investigation involving Maxwell.
Nascimento represents a female cooperating witness, arranging her meetings and travel with federal prosecutors.

events.title: Death of Alan Ross
events.description: The death of attorney Alan Ross, who previously represented the cooperating witness.

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoena Served
events.description: A federal agent served a grand jury subpoena to the cooperating witness, prompting her to contact Joseph Nascimento.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell's Arrest
events.description: The arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell is reported, prompting Attorney Nascimento to check in with prosecutors regarding his client's status.

events.title: Scheduled In-Person Meeting in New York
events.description: A planned in-person meeting in New York between the cooperating witness, her attorney, and federal prosecutors, with discussions about COVID-19 protocols.

locations: Hilton in West Palm Beach (Okeechobee Blvd)
Southern District of New York (SDNY) office
Blue Spoon coffee shop (near SDNY office)
keyFacts: Joseph Nascimento represents a female cooperating witness in the Epstein investigation who was previously represented by his deceased partner, Alan Ross.
The correspondence shows ongoing cooperation from at least July 2019 through August 2021, including scheduling multiple proffer sessions and interviews.
The witness was served with a grand jury subpoena on July 6, 2019.
Prosecutors affirm the witness's cooperative status and that nothing in the investigation has changed their view of her, indicating she is not a target.
Logistics discussed include in-person meetings in Florida and New York, video conferences, and adjustments for COVID-19 protocols and hurricane threats.
